Conditional constraints: If the error-status field of the Response-PDU is non-zero, the value fields of the variable bindings in the variable binding list are ignored

If both the error-status field and the error-index field of the Response-PDU are non-zero, then the value of the error-index field is the index of the variable binding (in the variable-binding list of the corresponding request) for which the request failed

mandatory: It is mandatory that all SNMPv2 entities acting in an agent role be able to generate the following PDU types

It is mandatory that all SNMPv2 entities acting in a manager role be able to generate the following PDU types
all such implementations must be able to receive the following PDU types
all components of a PDU, including those whose values are ignored by the receiving SNMPv2 entity, must have valid ASN.1 syntax and encoding

Upon receipt of a GetRequest-PDU, the receiving SNMPv2 entity processes each variable binding
All fields of the Response-PDU have the same values as the corresponding fields of the received request except as indicated below
Each variable binding is processed as follows
then the variable binding's value field is set to the value of the named variable
then its value field is set to `noSuchObject'
the variable binding's value field is set to `noSuchInstance'
then the Response-PDU is re-formatted with the same values in its request-id and variable-bindings fields as the received GetRequest-PDU
with the value of its error-status field set to `genErr'
the value of its error-index field is set to the index of the failed variable binding
the value of the Response-PDU's error-status field is set to `noError'
the value of its error-index field is zero
The generated Response-PDU is then encapsulated into a message
the message is transmitted to the originator of the GetRequest-PDU
an alternate Response-PDU is generated
This alternate Response-PDU is formatted with the same value in its request-id field as the received GetRequest-PDU
with the value of its error-status field set to `tooBig'
the value of its error-index field set to zero
an empty variable-bindings field
This alternate Response-PDU is then encapsulated into a message
the message is transmitted to the originator of the GetRequest-PDU
the snmpSilentDrops counter is incremented
the resultant message is discarded
is generated and transmitted at the request of
Upon receipt of a GetNextRequest-PDU, the receiving SNMPv2 entity processes each variable binding
All fields of the Response-PDU have the same values as the corresponding fields of the received request except as indicated below
Each variable binding is processed as follows
The corresponding variable binding's name and value fields in the Response-PDU are set to the name and value of the located variable
the corresponding variable binding produced in the Response-PDU has its value field set to `endOfMibView'
its name field set to the variable binding's name in the request
the Response-PDU is re-formatted with the same values in its request-id and variable-bindings fields as the received GetNextRequest-PDU
the value of its error-status field set to `genErr'
the value of its error-index field is set to the index of the failed variable binding
the value of the Response-PDU's error-status field is set to `noError'
the value of its error-index field is zero
The generated Response-PDU is then encapsulated into a message
the message is transmitted to the originator of the GetNextRequest-PDU
an alternate Response-PDU is generated
This alternate Response-PDU is formatted with the same values in its request-id field as the received GetNextRequest-PDU
the value of its error-status field set to `tooBig'
the value of its error-index field set to zero
an empty variable-bindings field
This alternate Response-PDU is then encapsulated into a message
the message is transmitted to the originator of the GetNextRequest-PDU
the snmpSilentDrops counter is incremented and the resultant message is discarded
shall have the same value

is set to `endOfMibView'

is set to `endOfMibView'

is set to the (N + r)-th variable binding's name

Conditional constraints: If the value in the non-repeaters field is less than zero, then the value of the field is set to zero
if the value in the max-repetitions field is less than zero, then the value of the field is set to zero
If N is greater than zero
If the requested variable binding's name does not lexicographically precede the name of any variable accessible by this request
If M and R are non-zero
if there is no (i)-th lexicographic successor

if the size of the message encapsulating the Response-PDU containing the requested number of variable bindings would be greater than either a local constraint or the maximum message size of the originator, then the response is generated with a lesser number of variable bindings
if for some value of iteration i, such that i is greater than zero and less than or equal to M, that all of the generated variable bindings have the value field set to the `endOfMibView'
If the processing of any variable binding fails for a reason other than listed above, then the Response-PDU is re-formatted
If the size of the resultant message is less than or equal to both a local constraint and the maximum message size of the originator, it is transmitted to the originator
Otherwise, the snmpSilentDrops counter is incremented and the resultant message is discarded

processes each variable binding in the variable-binding list to produce a Response-PDU
All fields of the Response-PDU have the same values as the corresponding fields of the received request except as indicated below
the variable bindings are conceptually processed as a two phase operation
the following validations are performed in the first phase on each variable binding until they are all successful, or until one fails
then the value of the Response-PDU's error-status field is set to
the value of its error-index field is set to the index of the failed variable binding

At the end of the first phase, if the validation of all variable bindings succeeded, then the value of the Response-PDU's error-status field is set to `noError' and the value of its error-index field is zero
processing continues as follows
For each variable binding in the request, the named variable is created if necessary, and the specified value is assigned to it
Each of these variable assignments occurs as if simultaneously with respect to all other assignments specified in the same request
then all other assignments are undone
the Response-PDU is modified to have the value of its error-status field set to `commitFailed'
the value of its error-index field set to the index of the failed variable binding
then the Response-PDU is modified to have the value of its error-status field set to `undoFailed'
the value of its error-index field is set to zero
the generated Response-PDU is encapsulated into a message, and transmitted to the originator
Prohibited: could under no circumstances be assigned
does not exist and could not ever be created
can not be created under the present circumstances
can not be modified no matter what new value is specified
is presently inconsistent or otherwise unable to be assigned
requires the allocation of a resource which is presently unavailable
fails for a reason other than listed above
it is not possible to undo all the assignments
Recommended: implementors are at liberty to implement either the first, or second, or both, of these conceptual phases as multiple implementation phases
implementations are strongly encouraged to take all possible measures to avoid use of either `commitFailed' or `undoFailed'
